TopicTitle: A Nearly Or Entirely Black Skybox

Articles.Content: I saw a thread on the KSP subreddit a while ago where a user had an entirely black skybox. Is there a way to install that easily? I'm on a Mac, so Windows instructions don't work.

> 
> I saw a thread on the KSP subreddit a while ago where a user had an entirely black skybox. Is there a way to install that easily? I'm on a Mac, so Windows instructions don't work.

Hey man, looking into it, looks like you need the [Universe replacer mod](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/44135-0-22-Universe-Replacer-v4-0)

Then just swap the skybox files for black .jpg files.

Oinker actually just released an almost black skybox. You might like a peek ![;)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif). [**LINK**](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/107471-1-0-2-TextureReplacer-2-4-6-%285-6-2015%29?p=2002681&viewfull=1#post2002681)

You could also use the TextureReplacer mod, or if you want a black skybox while on the ground or in the atmosphere, but don't mind a few stars when you are in orbit, you could use Distant Object Enhancement - which allows you to see planets and ships from a distance as well as making the skybox mostly black when looking towards the sun or the reflected light of a planet (and thus when on the surface of one as well).
